content: Agent Nexus is a cognitive agent architecture that enables AI systems to reason and solve complex problems.
The memory system is divided into short-term and long-term components, allowing the agent to maintain context across interactions.
Tools in Agent Nexus are modular components that provide specific capabilities to the cognitive system.
VectorSearch is a tool that enables semantic similarity search using embeddings and vector databases.
The planning system creates structured plans to solve complex tasks and coordinates with the action system.
Weaviate is a vector database that powers semantic search capabilities in Agent Nexus.
Environment variables can be configured in .env.local to control various aspects of the system.
Agent Nexus can be used with different model providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, and Ollama.
The Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pattern enhances text generation by incorporating relevant information from a vector database.
Unit tests and integration tests ensure the reliability of the Agent Nexus architecture.
